intro: Chiococca macrocarpa, commonly known as the giant cocoa tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and are often fragrant. The plant produces large, woody fruits that contain several seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
